title: Understanding HPLC
text: High-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) is a technique used to separate, identify, and quantify components in a mixture. It relies on a liquid mobile phase and a stationary phase.

title: Key Feature of HPLC
text: One of the key features of HPLC is the use of high pressure to push the mobile phase through the column, allowing for faster and more efficient separation.

title: Identifying the Mobile Phase
text: What is the mobile phase in HPLC?

title: Applications of HPLC
text: HPLC is widely used in pharmaceuticals, environmental testing, and food analysis to separate and analyze compounds.

hintAnswer: It separates components based on their interactions with the stationary phase.
title: Understanding the Stationary Phase
text: What role does the stationary phase play in HPLC?
choices: It separates components based on their interactions with the stationary phase.
It is used to heat the sample.
